video:video.video:title: Pranking Softies: The Faces of Microsoft campaign

video:video.video:description: In Office 2007 or Office 2010 you can place your favorite commands in the aptly named Quick Access Toolbar (QAT) to always have them at the ready regardless what tab or Ribbon you are working in. Doug&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Office Intervention: The Opera Episode - Part Two

video:video.video:title: Office Intervention: The Opera Episode - Part One
video:video.video:description: The Seattle Opera needs organizational help and our Office Intervention Team is there to help with SharePoint in hand. This is Part One which helps set up the story and talks about the issues the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1985
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1985 brings the announcement of the release of Microsoft MacEnhancer expansion system, the Microsoft Mouse is quarantined in Canada and Microsoft celebrates its 10th Anniversary.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1984
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1984 means a partnership with Apple, Microsoft Press Introduces its first two titles and we create a new Hardware and Peripherals Division dedicated to developing and marketing hardware&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1983
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1983 means the end of an era with the resignation of Paul Allen, the introduction of MS - DOS 2.0 and the formation of Microsoft Press, a trade-book publishing division specializing in&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1982
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1982 means a new Chief Operating Officer, a new logo and the very first in-house fax machine. Previous Episodes:The History of Microsoft - 1975The History of Microsoft - 1976The&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1981
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1981 means an entrance into the Operating Systems Business, we organize into a privately help organization and revenue jumps to over 17 million bucks. Previous Episodes:The History of&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1980
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1980 means a new decade and new technology. Microsoft introduces the Z-80 SoftCard, Steve Ballmer joins the company and we announce XENIX OS, a portable, UNIX-based operating system&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1979
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1979 is all about Basic when the M6800 version of Microsoft Basic is released, The 8080 version of Microsoft® Basic is the first microprocessor software product to win the ICP Million&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1978
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1978 begins with the announcement of the Microsoft COBOL-80, which conforms to the 1974 ANSI standards for 8080, Z80, and 8085 microprocessor systems. We establish our first&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1977
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1977 marks the beginning of an official partnership between Paul Allen and Bill Gates, we hire our first official employee and the FORTRAN-80, Microsoft's second language product&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1976
video:video.video:description: For Microsoft, 1976 was the first year with an official name, it was the first time Bill Gates raised the issue of piracy and we hired our first full-time employee Marc McDonald. Previous The History&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The History of Microsoft - 1975
video:video.video:description: Thirty-four years ago, a nineteen year old kid and his twenty-two year old business partner sold their first program to a little computer company in Albuquerque, New Mexico. The program was called&#8230;

video:video.video:description: Learn where the Brain has been since the last PDC. I discover what the brain likes to do when not developing software; why a jar and if it is a mascot?

video:video.video:title: Microsoft's Holiday Preview - Zune

video:video.video:description: This is the first community prototype from Office Labs. Community prototypes are projects Microsoft employees work on in their spare time. Speed Launch's goal is to let you get to the stuff you use&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Channel 10 Round-up: Halocast
video:video.video:description: I thought I would give an update with what's happening in the world of Channel 10 . I make my way through the channel 10 site and talk about specific text posts or videos we have done in the past&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Search Share: A new facebook application
video:video.video:description: Search Share lets you find all kinds of videos, images and other information online and then share it very easily with friends. But Search Share goes beyond typical web search - you see visual&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Zine: A new facebook application
video:video.video:description: Zine is your own online magaZINE of articles and videos that you personalize to include the topics you care about. Zine makes it easy to dig deeper into stories that interest you, and to share stories&#8230;

video:video.video:title: A look back at my life with Bill Gates

video:video.video:title: Carbon Grove: Green on-line campaign

video:video.video:title: Live Search for Mobile
video:video.video:description: I spend some time with Gary Voronel from the Microsoft Mobile Search Group. He shows off Live Search for Mobile. Live Search for mobile is your essential mobile companion – search for businesses,&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Windows Live Messenger for Facebook

video:video.video:title: Zune Spring Update 2.5 - The Video

video:video.video:title: Zune Guts
video:video.video:description: At Zune Blogger Day today we got an inside peek inside the Zune and I mean an inside peek. We were there to celebrate the Zune Spring Update Version 2.5 but the Zune team got a bit creative and threw&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Popfly: On Set with Halo Master Chief
video:video.video:description: We all know the success that Master Chief has had with Halo but sometimes you just need a change. I mean, saving the Earth and all is cool but what about just a simple life. One that doesn't involve&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Popfly: Auditioning for the role of PUNCHOUT boxer
video:video.video:description: Okay, so I don't know if you have ever been on a casting call but the idea is that you go on an audition for a role that you are &quot;right&quot; for. Check out the cast of freaks that showed up for&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Popfly: On Set with the Tetris Pieces
video:video.video:description: Working with &quot;real&quot; tetris pieces just sucks. I'm serious. First off, I ordered four pieces but apparantely the square and T piece were on strike because of the high gas prices. I know,&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Popfly: On Set with Mario
video:video.video:description: Oh Mario...what a sensitive little guy. We hired Mario because of his experience. He's been a Doctor, he's been Super...but what we didn't know is that he's tired of it all. His agent mentioned&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Popfly: On Set for the Gangsta Game
video:video.video:description: Working with thugs isn't all it's cracked up to be. And don't get me started on female pimps, they're the worst. We hired a thug and pimp to help create our gangsta game and well, they were just&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Popfly: On Set with Frogger
video:video.video:description: I'm sure you've all heard by now that Frogger has been on a downward spiral since he was booted as sexiest frog alive by Kermit. He started drinking, cursing and ran off to Vegas for a quickie&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Popfly: On the Set of Pong
video:video.video:description: People make fun of Pong all the time. Oh, it's just two paddles and a ball - it's boring, you don't kill anybody and there's no animated hero that is preparing to save the world. Well, Pong is&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Making Games...before Popfly Game Creator
video:video.video:description: The Popfly Game Creator offers a fun and easy way to create and share personalized games. Creating a game with Popfly is as simple as selecting actors, specifying a scene, and then defining behaviors&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Office Labs: Project "Community Clips"
video:video.video:description: Community Clips is a portal for viewing, sharing, and discussing informal &quot;how-to&quot; videos (screencasts) on Microsoft Office products. It also includes a client application for easy recording&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Rendering - What exactly is it?
video:video.video:description: Rendering is the process of generating an image from a model, by means of computer programs. The model is a description of three dimensional objects in a strictly defined language or data structure.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Iron Man for the Xbox 360 - May 2nd

video:video.video:title: Second Life - How to get started

video:video.video:title: Silverlight Rehab - You're not alone
video:video.video:description: Trying Silverlight can lead to an addiction. We know this. But you're not alone. Whether you're a Developer, Designer or just a web junkie...there's people out there just like you. Don't be afraid&#8230;

video:video.video:title: How to: Shoot and Edit a Time-Lapse Video

video:video.video:title: TechFest 2008: Reliable Wireless Connectivity on the Go

video:video.video:description: Who doesn't love television? Whether you're a sports fanatic, reality show buff or news Junkie...there's a little part in all of us that is somewhat obsessed with television. I am one of them. &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Barats and Bereta - the internet phenomenon/phenomena - which is it?
video:video.video:description: Okay people! Let's talk. Alright, me first. I love the internet. I really do. It's scary. I actually compare airline prices for trips I'm not even planning on taking. I know, strange...but&#8230;

video:video.video:description: Love games and gamers and looking for a great way to spend a weekend? Then plan now to attend the next Penny Arcade Expo (PAX), an annual gaming convention that has something for everyone.I headed&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Wetware: placing electrodes on the brain to treat children's epilepsy
video:video.video:description: We here at 10 are all huge Matrix fans, and so any technology that offers a computer interface into our brains. While they haven't developed a way to instantaneously teach us kung-fu, Dr. Jeff Ojemann&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Portable Ultrasound Machines!

video:video.video:title: John Edwards at Gnomedex
video:video.video:description: John Edwards spoke at Gnomedex to listen to the audience and learn more from them on how to open up the process of voting and choosing government officials. Of course blogging and podcasting came&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Free Geek - where PCs find new life
video:video.video:description: &quot;Helping the needy get nerdy&quot; is the motto at Free Geek, a non-profit PC recycling center. In this video we get to follow along with Tina as she tours the center through the whole process. &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Windows Live Spaces goes "Live"
video:video.video:description: MSN Spaces has evolved and will now be known as Windows Live Spaces. This is not just a simple name change but a feature packed update, including gadgets, games, photos, feeds and a friends list.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Microsoft Humanitarian Systems!
video:video.video:description: When you think of natural disaster, software programs rarely come to mind. But Ted Okada and Robert Kirkpatrick of Microsoft’s Humanitarian Systems know from experience that where there's a crisis,&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Major Nelson gives us the latest...
video:video.video:description: This time the big guy dropped by to tell us whats new on LIVE! and then walk us through the free multi-player demo of Ghost Recon Advanced WarFighter.

video:video.video:title: Behind the scenes of a real DNA lab
video:video.video:description: Join Tina on a tour of Genelex, a real DNA lab, and learn about that crazy nucleic acid that we all love. While she's there, Tina starts the process of getting tested to learn about her geographical&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Theory in Motion, part 1
video:video.video:description: Danny James and Dillin Quent of Theory in Motion stop by the studio to drop the beat. Very nice. Recognize the song from somewhere?

video:video.video:title: Cool, as in liquid cooled, custom PCs
video:video.video:description: Jon Bach, of Puget Custom Computers, impresses Tina with a monster gaming machine kept cool by a custom designed liquid cooling system.

video:video.video:title: Today in Tech
video:video.video:description: Technology News as presented by Laura and Tina, news desk, blazers, smart-looking glasses and all. Ok, well maybe not the blazers or the news desk...or even the smart-looking glasses. But the news,&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Internet Phenomenon - Leeroy Jenkins
video:video.video:description: Let's all take a moment to remember Leeroy Jenkins and the impact he's had on society, the internet and the Pals for Life coin purses.

video:video.video:title: Touring KEXP, internet radio super station
video:video.video:description: Tina and Laura take a tour of KEXP 90.3, an independent radio station that streams live over the internet. No sponsors, no commercials just whatever the DJ wants to play, streaming out to a global&#8230;
